com.amplifyframework.api.aws.sigv4

Class DefaultCognitoUserPoolsAuthProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amplifyframework.api.aws.sigv4.DefaultCognitoUserPoolsAuthProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CognitoUserPoolsAuthProvider

    public final class DefaultCognitoUserPoolsAuthProvider
extends java.lang.Object
implements CognitoUserPoolsAuthProvider
    Basic retrieval of the Cognito Userpools token. The user must have already signed-in before using this class as the retrieval mechanism. This provider requires AWSMobileClient singleton instance to be already initialized to successfully fetch the token.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DefaultCognitoUserPoolsAuthProvider()
      Creates the object with the instance of AWSMobileClient pulled over from the Auth plugin.
      DefaultCognitoUserPoolsAuthProvider(AWSMobileClient awsMobileClient)
      Creates this with a specific instance of AWSMobileClient - currently used for testing.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getLatestAuthToken()
      Vends the latest valid authentication token from Cognito User Pool session.
      java.lang.String getUsername()
      Returns the currently logged in user's name from local cache.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

                                    throws ApiException
        Creates the object with the instance of AWSMobileClient pulled over from the Auth plugin. TODO: Once we come up with a proper interface, we will remove the use of AWSMobileClient directly in favor of using the AuthSession from Auth.
        Throws:
        ApiException - Thrown if the AWSCognitoAuth plugin is not added.
